description: "Dropping time" in 3x+1 problem starting at 2n+1 (number of steps to reach a lower number than starting value). Also called glide(2n+1).
comments: If the starting value is even then of course the next step in the trajectory is smaller (cf. A102419).
links: T. D. Noe, Table of n, a(n) for n=0..10000

Index entries for sequences related to 3x+1 (or Collatz) problem
mathematica: nxt[n_]:=If[OddQ[n],3n+1,n/2]; Join[{0},Table[Length[NestWhileList[nxt, n,#>=n&]]-1, {n,3,191,2}]]  (* _Harvey P. Dale_, Apr 23 2011 *)
prog: (Haskell)a060445 0 = 0a060445 n = length $ takeWhile (>= n') $ a070165_row n'            where n' = 2 * n + 1-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 11 2013
